effects.description: For the next minute the creature loses 1d4 hit points at the start of each of its turns until it uses an action to staunch this wound.
effects.name: Minor Bleeding

effects.description: For the next minute the creature loses 1d12 hit points at the start of each of its turns until it uses an action to staunch this wound.
effects.name: Major Bleeding

effects.description: For the next minute the creature loses 1d8 hit points at the start of each of its turns until it uses an action to staunch this wound.
effects.name: Medium Bleeding

effects.description: While the creature is on fire it takes 2d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can end this condition by dropping prone and using 5 feet of movement to roll on the ground.
effects.name: On Fire

effects.description: While the creature is on fire it takes 2d6 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can end this condition by dropping prone and using 5 feet of movement to roll on the ground.
effects.name: Ablaze

effects.description: While the creature is on fire it takes 2d8 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can end this condition by dropping prone and using 5 feet of movement to roll on the ground.
effects.name: Inferno

effects.description: If the creature has resistance to fire, it loses that resistance. If the creature does not have resistance to fire, it gains vulnerability to fire.
effects.name: Charred

effects.description: Attack rolls have advantage when made against the creature until the end of its next turn.
effects.name: Heat Wave

effects.description:
- A frozen creature is transformed, along with any nonmagical object it is wearing or carrying, into a solid inanimate substance (usually ice). Its weight increases and it ceases aging.
- The creature is incapacitated (see the condition), can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
- Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
- The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
- The creature is immune to poison and disease, although a poison or disease already in its system is suspended, not neutralized. Remove all movement, grant advantage to all who attack, and add damage resistance to all magical and physical attacks
effects.name: Frozen

effects.description:
- A frozen creature is incapacitated (see the condition) and can't move or speak.
- The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
- Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.
effects.name: Freezing

effects.description: The creature’s movement speed is 0 until the end of its next turn.
effects.name: Frost

effects.description: Disadvantage on ability checks and speed halved
effects.name: Injured Leg

effects.description: For the next minute the creature loses 2d8 hit points at the start of each of its turns until it uses an action to staunch this wound.
effects.name: Severe Bleeding

effects.description: The nex attack roll has advantage when made against the creature.
effects.name: Off Balance

effects.description:
- A stunned creature is incapacitated (see the condition), can't move, and can speak only falteringly.
- The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
- Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
effects.name: Ringing Blow

effects.description: The creature bleeds and loses 1d6 hit points at the start of its next turn.
effects.name: Open Cut

effects.description:
- A stunned creature is incapacitated (see the condition), can't move, and can speak only falteringly.
- The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
- Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
effects.name: Smashed

effects.description: The creature has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.
effects.name: Badly Beaten

effects.description: The creature has disadvantage on Constitution and Death saving throws.
effects.name: Edge of Death

effects.description: The creature’s movement speed is halved.
effects.name: Chilled

effects.description: Crippled leg! The creature’s movement speed is reduced by 10 feet and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.
effects.name: Crippled Leg

effects.description: Randomly determine one of the creature’s arms. That arm cannot be used to hold an item and any ability check requiring that arm automatically fails or has disadvantage (DM’s choice).
effects.name: Crippled Arm

effects.description: Randomly determine one of the creature’s arms. That arm cannot be used to hold a shield and the creature has disadvantage on any rolls involving the use of that arm.
effects.name: Injured Arm

effects.description: While scarred the creature has disadvantage on all Charisma ability checks except Charisma (Intimidation). Being scarred can be healed in the same way as a minor injury.
effects.name: Scarred

effects.description: While disfigured the creature has disadvantage on all Charisma ability checks except Charisma (Intimidation). Being disfigured can be removed with the spell greater restoration.
effects.name: Disfigured

effects.description: If the creature is wearing armor its AC modifier is reduced by 1 until it can be repaired (for 1/4th the price of new armor of the same type) or cleaned (if the armor is magical). If the creature is not wearing armor, roll on the minor injury chart.
effects.name: Armor damaged 1

effects.description: If the creature is wearing armor, roll on the minor injury chart and its AC modifier is reduced by 2 until it can be repaired (for half the price of new armor of the same type) or cleaned (if the armor is magical). If the creature is not wearing armor, roll on the major injury chart.
effects.name: Armor damaged 2

effects.description: If the creature is wearing armor, the armor is destroyed (if non-magical) or rendered useless until cleaned during a long rest (if magical) and roll on the major injury chart. If the creature is not wearing armor, roll on the major injury chart and the creature is disfigured. While disfigured the creature has disadvantage on all Charisma ability checks except Charisma (Intimidation). Being disfigured can be removed with the spell greater restoration.
effects.name: Acid Bath

effects.description: The next attack made against the creature before the start of its next turn has advantage.
effects.name: Weak Point

effects.description: The target creature suffers disadvantage on its next attack roll.
effects.name: Wear and Tear

effects.description: All attacks made against the creature before the start of its next turn have advantage.
effects.name: Exposed

effects.description: The creature’s maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equivalent to the damage dealt by the attack.
effects.name: Severly Wounded

effects.description: The creature’s maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equivalent to half of the damage dealt by the attack.
effects.name: Multiple Injuries

effects.description: Tthe creature is vulnerable against spells until the end of its next turn.
effects.name: Spellstruck

effects.description: The creature is spellbound for the next minute. While spellbound it is vulnerable against spells and spell attack rolls against it have advantage. At the end of each of the creature’s turns it can make an Intelligence saving throw (DC 14) to end this effect.
effects.name: Mystic Magnet

effects.description: The creature is spellbound for the next minute. While spellbound is vulnerable against spells spell attack rolls against it have advantage. At the end of each of the creature’s turns it can make an Intelligence saving throw (DC 14) to end this effect.
effects.name: Spellbound

effects.description: The creature is spellbound for the next minute. While spellbound it is vulnerable against spells and spell attack rolls against it have advantage. At the end of each of the creature’s turns it can make an Intelligence saving throw (DC 16) to end this effect.
effects.name: Enscorcelled

effects.description: The creature is spellbound for the next minute. While spellbound it is vulnerable against spells and spell attack rolls against it have advantage. At the end of each of the creature’s turns it can make an Intelligence saving throw (DC 16) to end this effect.
effects.name: Magically Mauled

effects.description: The creature cannot willingly move closer to you until the end of its next turn.
effects.name: Dazzled

effects.description: The creature is frightened until the end of its next turn. A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight. The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.
effects.name: Disheartened

effects.description: The creature is frightened for thenext minute. It can make a Wisdom saving throw (DC 16) at the end of each of its turns to end this effect. A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight. The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.
effects.name: Holy Terror

effects.description: The creature glows for the next minute. While glowing it produces bright light up 10 feet and dim light up to 30 feet and all successful attacks against the creature are granted a +2 bonus on the attack roll.
effects.name: Rightgeous Mark

effects.description: The creature glows for the next minute. While glowing it produces bright light up 10 feet and dim light up to 30 feet and all successful attacks against the creature are granted a +4 bonus on the attack roll.
effects.name: Punished

effects.description: The creature is deafened until the end of its next turn.. A deafened creature can't hear and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.
effects.name: Deafened 1

effects.description: The creature is deafened for one minute. A deafened creature can't hear and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.
effects.name: Deafened 2

effects.description: The creature is stunned until the start of its next turn A stunned creature is incapacitated (see the condition), can't move, and can speak only falteringly. The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
effects.name: Stunned 1

effects.description: The creature is stunned until the end of its next round. A stunned creature is incapacitated (see the condition), can't move, and can speak only falteringly. The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. Attack rolls against the creature have advantage.
effects.name: Stunned 2

effects.description: The creature’s movement on its next turn is controlled by the enemy.
effects.name: Disoriented

effects.description: The creature cannot differentiate friend from foe until the end of its next turn.
effects.name: Confused

effects.description: The creature’s action on its next turn is controlled by the enemy.
effects.name: Dominated

effects.description: The creature has disadvantage on its next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.
effects.name: Nauseous

effects.description: The creature has disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.
effects.name: Sickened

effects.description: The creature is poisoned for the next minute. The creature may attempt a saving throw at the end of each of its turns (DC 12) to end this effect. A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
effects.name: Poisonend 2

effects.description: The creature is poisoned for the next minute. The creature may attempt a saving throw at the end of each of its turns (DC 16) to end this effect. A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
effects.name: Poisonend 3
